title: Gerando pdfs com xelatex
text:
No arquivo .Rnw foram inseridos non-printable unicode characters obtidos aqui.
Para executar um container baseado na imagem docker da ploa 2024 abra o programa Docker Desktop e depois execute no terminal:
docker run --rm -p 8787:8787 -ti --mount type=bind,source=$(PWD),target=/home/rstudio volumes:ploa2024 bash
Dentro do container execute:
R CMD Sweave --pdf table.Rnw 
pdfinfo table.pdf 
Creator:        TeX
Producer:       pdfTeX-1.40.19
CreationDate:   Tue Sep 19 19:56:43 2023 UTC
ModDate:        Tue Sep 19 19:56:43 2023 UTC
Tagged:         no
UserProperties: no
Suspects:       no
Form:           none
JavaScript:     no
Pages:          1
Encrypted:      no
Page size:      612 x 792 pts (letter)
Page rot:       0
File size:      29704 bytes
Optimized:      no
PDF version:    1.5
Inicia sessão do Rstudio em http://localhost:8787/ (usuário: rstudio, senha: splor)
docker exec -d -e PASSWORD=splor volumes-loa /init



Avaliar substituição de pdflatex por xelatex ou lualatex · Issue #53 · splor-mg/volumes-loa
Customizing LaTeX Options in the RStudio IDE – Posit Support
Using Sweave and knitr – Posit Support
r - Difference: “Compile PDF” button in RStudio vs. knit() and knit2pdf() - Stack Overflow
latex - Running xelatex programmatically from R script - Stack Overflow
tips/tex/tex-tips.Rmd at master · jrminter/tips
xetex - How to use texi2dvi to run latex generating PDF? - TeX - LaTeX Stack Exchange
R Manuals :: R Internals - 11  Use of TeX dialects
tools::texi2dvi makes use of a system command texi2dvi where available. On a Unix-alike this is usually part of texinfo, whereas on Windows if it exists at all it would be an executable, part of MiKTeX. If none is available, the R code runs a sequence of (pdf)latex, bibtex and makeindex commands.

tips/tex/tex-tips.Rmd at master · jrminter/tips
xetex - How to use texi2dvi to run latex generating PDF? - TeX - LaTeX Stack Exchange
R Manuals :: R Internals - 11  Use of TeX dialects
tools::texi2dvi makes use of a system command texi2dvi where available. On a Unix-alike this is usually part of texinfo, whereas on Windows if it exists at all it would be an executable, part of MiKTeX. If none is available, the R code runs a sequence of (pdf)latex, bibtex and makeindex commands.
